alert.note: Alert for Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 02 at 2:04AM EDT until July 02 at 5:15AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New York, including the following county, Clinton. * WHEN...Until 515 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of some streets, rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 203 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mooers, Altona, Ellenburg Depot, Ellenburg, Irona, Miner Lake State Park, Mooers Forks and Sciota. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
